description:
I learned DTP back with QuarkXPress 3.31 and 4. For better or worse, this program draws from the straight forward approach of Quark, before they exported everything overseas and collapsed. 
I was able to teach my Ma QuarkXPress so she could make her bowling league flyers. Moving her to Scribus was quick.
Whenever I make documentation for work and all they want is a PDF, Scribus is my go-to - especially if graphics are required. I've taught so many Word savants how to do some basic DTP - which was light years beyond what Word was capable of - and they've never looked back either.
is opening and messing up the format
summary: is opening and messing up the format

description:
It remaind me of Aldus Page Maker, one of the best tools in industry when I worked on DTP. 
BTW, this is a real DTP tool, not just an appendix like Publisher is. It's a nonsense to compare apples to linuxes... er.. oranges.
summary: So close to professional DTP Tools

description: Ive used other Desktop Publishing programs and Scribus is as good if not better. Most of what I've wanted to do was very easily figured out on my own. A few items have been able to figure out with online documentation and forums. I highly reccomend it.
its good, but not as good as microsoft publisher. it's has hi curve to learn

For this being a page layout programme, inputting basic text is a throwback to ancient dtp programmes from the 1980's. Why can't it be like every other dtp where I can draw a text frame, the cursor flashes and I can type directly into the text frame? It can be good and should be good with improvements and an upgrade to the 21st century. Let's hope that the developers are listening.
I used Page plus for a few years/projects. I've used MS Publisher, never used In Design. I'm really happy with Scribus working great for my needs.
It is a great open source alternative to indesign
summary: Great software that keeps getting better

description: Scribus does have some user interface peculiarities that makes it hard to learn and less pleasing to use. But it's the only tool I've dealt with which have managed to create compliant PDFs that every single printing firm I've dealt with has accepted whether it for T-Shirt prints, SKP, flyers and so on.
summary: The best tool to use for print material on linux

description: Hard to use, hard to manage, hard to understand. Many times I prefer to format my contents in Inkscape (which is not designed for this kind of stuffs) than have to use Scribus. It is popular only due the lack of alternatives.

I wrote the book on using Scribus for book covers. It is now being rewritten
under the title "Eyecatching Book Covers"

If a book interior is heavy on graphics it is also convenient. But I prefer some
form of TeX for automation of TOC and index plus precision typesetting.
summary: Great for book covers and interiors heavy on graphics.

description: Almost in every case I decided to use Scribus for DTP, I hit a wall of incompatibility with my SVG material. I would always return to Inkscape to finish the work before sending it to the printer. I'd kill for useful specialized open source DTP software. Unfortunately Scribus is not it.
Good tool, good quality.
Sounds like this program hasn't been updated in years. the GUI buttons and toolbar are microscopic on a HiDPI screen. At least text scales, but the UI is still unusable.
summary: Toolbar is microscopic in a HiDPI screen

description: I spent two weeks looking at YouTube tutorials and teaching myself Scribus (Please someone tell the Americans it is Scribus derived from the word 'scribe', can't think why that is, not Scrib-us). The set about my first project a 16 page four colour brochure for an artist with heavy image work. Brilliant results and everyone says of the brochure "That looks top quality and a superb design.". I have seen criticisms of this package but I tend to think these come from people not willing to do the work to learn exactly what Scribus can do and how it does it. I am very happy with it and am producing a whole load of work on it now.

I have been working as a professional graphic designer for over 20 years now. When ever I really need to create brochures and in effect any preprint layouts that just work as files that I can send to any printer I turn to Scribus. I love how styles and colours are managed and how precise I can work in regards to exact positioning and typography. It is amazing what the development team has managed to pull off here. No proprietary tools are needed.
Linux OS has all the goodies free open source and that make less budget peoples' life easier.... I love scribus
summary: This is one of the tool that made me move to Linux OS

description: This software is very good for publishing. It took me a little bit of time and effort, but I'm happy to be enable to create posters, cards and some brochures. It's very precise and it's possible to use external texts such as .odt with the styles embedded. Best publishing tool I know.
No complaints, appreciate all the work put into Scribus. Lets me make pages for my community magazine with no trouble.
summary: Just what I was looking for

description: the bugs make the program impossible to work.

I am trying to unlink myself from Microsoft mainly because of its current business plan. However, I have to use the Microsoft Publisher program for much of my work. Publisher is a great program for quickly laying out everything from a simple photo to a multi page book. I had hoped that Scribus would do the same, but as Callean noted its over complicated. It would take me days to do what I now do on Publisher in just a couple of hours.
summary: If you are used to MS Publisher you will quickly give up on this one

description:
Scribus is great for illustrated magazines and brochures, to create PDF files - even interactive - and print (it’s cmyk capable). Its approach to use styles for everything ensures a consistent layout of paragraphs, character styles, colors, lines etc.
There are a lot of helpful features, and if you need something Scribus is not so good in, you can import a variety of image formats and PDF. I use LibreOffice for tables and Inkscape and Gimp to create graphics. Since I layouted my first magazine in Inkscape, I love it.
summary: Best Tool to Create Illustrated Magazines

description: Startup could be faster. Also, working with color swatches is a bit cumbersome.

I think this program is not there yet. I've used InDesign for over 10 years and Affinity Publisher for a few. And I want to switch to Open Source and Linux. And to switch to Scribus is somewhat challenging. I'm trying my best to be patient and get to know it. 

But really. From the bottom of my heart... I appreciate your work, but please make is identical to InDesign. I don't care what your GNU philosophy is. Make it easier for industry professionals to transition from Adobe InDesign. You'll get many more followers and users with great skill who can help contribute to a masterpiece showcase for you.
summary: Please please PLEASE make it identical to InDesign in everyway!

description: I somtimes do flyers, posters, and I do a lot of book typesetting, and this is really the best solution I've found. Not perfect, but the new interface rocks. Keep up the good work. Thanks.

I have been using Scribus more and more for creating not only preprint material but also for screen presentations because it has powerful master pages and style settings that are easy to use and reliable in printed documents as well as on screen.
Extremely poor performance. File output sizes - original pdf 127kb, after scribus 23mb. Waste of time
summary: Probably one of the nastiest pieces of software I have used

description: I've used Scribus since 2012 ... and have made some books (in pdf).

1.5.x is an amazing piece of software, as good as Quark Xpress or Adobe InDesign once you're used to its GUI, and it is pretty easy to master if you understand how a page layout application works (it is similar to good old PageMaker).

Why isn't a stable version of Scribus offered? A version that is totally unusable has been offered. When I import a PDF into an image box he sees only one page and when I type in which page I want to see in the box, he doesn’t react to it. This version of Scribus cannot be used and the stable version 1.4.8 cannot be installed.

I love the program, and would rate it more highly, but my windows using coworkers who downloaded the executable stable branch can't open my files, and now I have to compile from source. I wouldn't mind if both dev and stable were available, but on a LTS distro, STABLE not DEV BRANCH, please?
summary: Why is the Dev Branch version on a LTS distro?

description: Stable version, please. Can't even install stable from CLI.
summary: Give us the stable version, please

description: ScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribusScribus
I've been using this software for professional layouts since the early 1.4 series and I'm really liking the newest 1.5.6.1 ---keep up the good work.
summary: Thanks! This program is really headed in the right direction

description: Great app nice work
Really powerfull and easy to use
Too slow and unresponsive to use on my 11gen i7

it's generally usable and the UI is responsive even running on the iGPU.

there are some functions of the UI that could stand to be improved.
in general this software is hard to beat on GNU/Linux if you are looking for a good alternative to Adobe-InDesign and other proprietary sw from Corel.

you can use this program to do serious/pro work if you are working solo or in small teams. if you want to export for print then you need a calibrated monitor. there is software for that as well for GNU/Linux. look for DisplayCAL and Argyll + a hardware calibrator.

good luck !
I can easily do any complex task that I need to edit my comic. I have bought a liscence of some Serif alternative but this one beats it!! Amazing!
This is the development branch, and as such is buggy.
It helped me a lot with adding shapes to the existing PDF document.

First DTP program I learned so nothing to unlearn. I started teaching myself how to use this two years ago using YouTube tutorials of the most recent versions and a book "Beginning Scribus" by Robert White.

Slow going at first, of course, but got quicker with each edition of a regular 40 page journal I'm producing. With each edition I learn something new to increase efficiency and speed up. Now up to the seventh edition and I'm flying.

Those having difficulty with it - be patient and learn to use it. Look at me, I'm 70 and found it relatively easy going. That's the way it is with any new subject.
summary: Awesome program that's very simple and quick

description: I have been using Scribus with a few other FOSS graphic and art tools to make and convert some Adobe InDesign/Publisher and Affinity Designer/Publisher documents to Scribus format and SVGs. I've only had issues with a few of the bleeding edge tools or wonky graphics, but other than that, its been able todo everything I need it to do! Provided I have the fonts required.

It does really all I need a desktop publishing application to use. Extraordinarily happy with it. When I started looking at FLOSS for my switch to Linux and found Scribus, I knew I could do it. Thank you to the developers - it is fantastic.
I use and like Scribus, but this development release has problems for regular use. A flatpak of the latest stable release would be better.
summary: good, but the stable release would be better

description: I'd also like to see stable release ported to Flatpak

Steht vergleichbaren DTP Programmen kaum nach und ist insbesondere bei Projekten wie Schulzeitung, Vereinshefte, Bedienungsanleitungen, Tutorials, Essays, Clubs usw.) vollkommen ausreichend. 

Sollte viel mehr im öffentlichen Raum genutzt werden. Kann gerade jungen Menschen als Unterrichtsmittel zu Fertigkeiten moderner Medien gereicht werden.
Habe für die Erstellung von meiner Arbeitsbewerbung verwendet. Wirklich sehr übersichtlich und ausreichend ausgestattet mit diversen Tools.
Benutze Scribus seit Jahren für die Erstellung von Zeitschriften, Plakaten, Flyern. Braucht etwas Einarbeitung, ist dann aber ein wirklich umfangreiches und gutes Tool.
Das Programm erfüllt professionelle Ansprüche, ich veröffentliche damit regelmäßig eine 200-Seiten-Publikation mit lebendigem Layout. Die Druckerei hat an den erzeugten PDFs nichts auszusetzen.

Ich bin Beginner im DTP.
Aber bis jetzt macht mir das Programm einen sehr guten Eindruck!
summary: Auf den ersten Blick sehr gut

description: Ein wenig gewöhnungsbedürftig aber alles dabei.
Kann bitte jemand diese fürchterliche Development-version 1.5.5 entfernen und durch etwas erträgliches ersetzen!
summary: Eine Entwicklerversion hat hier nichts verloren!

description: kuchau SIUUUUU
Anda regio, le faltan un par de cosillas como poder pasar de una el texto saturado en un cuadro de texto pero en fin, cumple el propósito.
el programa es bueno, sin embargo esta dando un error (Signal 11) y cierra el programa( Una lastima!
Donde puedo localizar ortografia en este software...?

es bastante parecido a como trabaja Indesign de Adobe, lo ùnico que me encantarìa que le actualizaran al programa es la busqueda y reemplazo automatico de imagenes, si tienes un proyecto de 300 pàginas y se desactualizan los vinculos de las imagenes, para volver a poner las imagenes lo tienes que hacer manual.
Permite maquetar los más diversos materiales de un modo fácil y dinámico.
Excelente programa de edición similar al Publisher de Microsoft.
Fácil uso y manejable
aaaaaaa es imposible trabajar asi :c
summary: Por favor corregir el error de signal#11

description: Ágil simple y con todo lo necesario.
summary: realmente muy útil para hacer folleteria

description: un vrai logiciel de composition pour flyers et autres "papiers" de présentation. nickel !

La méthode de travail demandée par Scribus impose de définir préalablement ses feuilles de style et ses gabarits. C'est donc un outil professionnel qui ne laisse pas place à l'improvisation. Superbe outil !
Tout est dans le titre ! Scribus est indiqué comme étant propriétaire, mais c'est bien un (excellent) logiciel libre.
summary: Ceci est bien un logiciel libre

description: Petit bémol, elle n'est pas rétrocompatible, mais tellement plus adaptée aux professionnels de la pao (et compatible xpress). A quand la 1.6 stable ?
summary: Cette nouvelle version est vraiment top

description: Avec la version 1.5.4 c'est mieux. Pour moi il reste juste un bug génant de masquage des calques en PDF interactifs.
summary: Parfait pour la PAO et le PDF

description: Après quelques difficultés pour appréhender le logiciel, il est parfait et les résultats venant de mon imprimeur sont tout-à-fait corrects et conformes à ce que j'ai créé.
Tout simplement un des logiciels essentiels de création de visuels, un incontournable, BRAVO !

Les feuille de styles , une vrais galéré, impossible d’utilisée un fichier Css.
A planter, impossible de récupéré la sauve garde. 
version 1.4 sur Fedora 30. 
C'est clair , j'arriverais jamais à convaincre un habitué des solution Adobe avec se type de logiciel.
Très facile à l'utilisation après une petite formation de découverte. J'ai fait le journal municipal avec de 8 à 24 pages.
Pas de tests car pas de telechargement
J'utilise scribus depuis des année avant sous windows maintenant sous linux application très complète et surtout très intuitives avec de bons tutos qu'il suffit de chercher
Suis sur Lubuntu... la version de scribus ici est plus ancienne que celle que j’utilisais avant... je ne peux plus ouvrir mes fichiers! comment faire une mise à jour ?
La dernière Fedora est passée à la branche instable 1.5.x, c'est un erreur qui rend le logiciel beaucoup moins sûr. De plus toutes les fonctionnalités de la version stable ne sont pas présentes :-(
summary: Il ne fallait pas passer à la version 1.5.x !

description: Pour avoir utiliser InDesign, ce logiciel tient la comparaison pour les fonctions de bases. Trés stable sur plus de 80 pages avec pas loin de 200 illustrations. En revanche, la prise en main n'est pas simple pour qui par de zero, la PAO a ses codes et ses pratiques. Bravo au monde du libre!

Attention les fichiers de cette version ne sont pas rétrocompatible. Dommage qu'elle ne soit pas encore dans les dépôts car elle fonctionne super bien et comporte pas mal d'améliorations. Beau travail

bonjour; bravo !.
ce logiciel m'a beaucoup aider à comprendre rapidement du graphisme.

Scribus est désormais une vraie référence pour l'édition de livre ou la création de leafflet. Perso je l'utilise à haute dose, et je le trouve super complet.? Il m'a permis de sortir des logiciels proprio pour mes créations graphiques. Attention les nouveaux documents (réalisés ou convertis sur1.5.x.x) ne sont pas reconnus par les anciennes versions de scribus 1.4.x.x
summary: On ne peut plus s'en passer ! merci

description: Одно из лучших приложений в своём роде.
Жалкое подобие InDesign. Верстать неудобно, логика работы с текстом непонятна. Зачем нужно было так извращаться?!
Многостраничный документ из SVG заготовок получается собрать довольно быстро.

Прежде чем начать пользоваться я упорно читал вики-мануал. Прошёл самостоятельно предлагаемый курс освоения всех функций. Мне требовало сделать хороший буклет-книжку для печати в типографии. Сдал макет в типографию и сразу получилось отлично! После этого делал: книжки, листовки, буклеты, визитки, баннеры, наборы типовых этикеток, графику для блогов и сайтов. Отличный инструмент. Не жалею, что потратил пару дней на изучения всех функций.
Полезный инструмент. Буклеты. Листовки. Флаеры. И конечно я потратил целый день, что бы пройти полный курс обучения. Но теперь я им пользуюсь уже больше 10 лет и доволен.
